column4: anybody wanna help? 1207 people in here..there has to be someone lol ;]

its not easy when you have 70 rar parts
so you want  a command that'll unrar them in bulk?
dude you are havbing problems trying to unrar and you want to start writing debian apps? :|
doesn't matter lol, i have done c++, and C# apps on windows and im pretty good with c++ and whats wrong with writing a deb app lol ;]
it would be alot easier if u guys tell me if there is a package that has what i need
isntead of just telling me to use the command line
you already have the package unrar - what you need to do is either select all .rar files right click and select extract here - or - write a script if the files are numerous and in folder heirarchy
also in *some* torrent downloads there is a single rar file and rest are named as .r01 .r02, if thats the case unrar only the .rar file rest will follow automatically
w\e i will if i could it get to work
open synaptic and search for unrar - what do you have installed
select a single rar file does it show you the command of extract here?
im suppose stupid, it actually does lol
